problem_results.title: Phi^4_3 measure equivalence under smooth shifts

tasks.task: P1-T1: Young's inequality for cubic/quartic domination
tasks.note: Pointwise bound verified; distributional lift requires Wick-ordering analysis (not numerically testable).

tasks.task: P1-T2: Wick expansion of V(phi-psi) - V(phi)
tasks.note: The cubic term dominates, confirming the claim in Section 4. The renormalization counterterm C appears only in the linear and constant terms, not in the cubic/quadratic terms.

tasks.gap_identified: Step 3 (pushforward preserves equivalence) was implicit in the original proof. Codex flagged this in p1-s6. The repair: if mu = f*nu with 0 < f < inf nu-a.s., then T^*mu = (f o T^{-1}) * T^*nu, and 0 < f o T^{-1} < inf T^*nu-a.s.
tasks.repair_status: CLOSED — the gap is a missing explicit step, not a mathematical error.

problem_results.title: Universal test vector for Rankin-Selberg integrals

tasks.theorem: Units of C[X, X^{-1}] are exactly c*X^k (c != 0, k in Z). Non-monomials have roots in C^x by FTA, hence are not units.
tasks.repair_status: CLOSED — the original Lemma 2.1 is correct. The gap was in the problem statement interpretation, now fixed.

tasks.task: P2-T2: PID submodule structure for R = C[X, X^{-1}]
tasks.theorem: C[X, X^{-1}] is a PID. Every nonzero submodule of a free rank-1 R-module is free of rank 1, generated by gcd of generators.
tasks.application: The fixed-W spanning argument (Section 3a, Lemma 3a.1) uses this to conclude that the integrals {I(s,phi,V)} generate a principal ideal L_phi * R.
tasks.repair_status: The PID argument itself is sound. The gap is whether L_phi = L(s, Pi x pi) (full L-factor), which requires the GL_n-equivariance + irreducibility argument (Task 3).

tasks.note: Discrete approximation of the equivariance identity I(s, R(g_0)phi, V) = |det g_0|^{1/2-s} * I(s, phi, R'(g_0)V). Ratio near 1.0 confirms the algebraic identity. Exact match requires proper Haar measure discretization.
tasks.repair_status: The equivariance computation is algebraically correct. The gap is in stating it explicitly in the proof (Codex flagged implicit use in Key Step). CLOSED by Lemma 3a.2.

tasks.task: P8-T1: Maslov index = 0 for 4-valent Lagrangian vertices
tasks.method: V1/V2 decomposition (algebraic, not det^2 phase winding)
tasks.repair_status: The Maslov index vanishes exactly for all valid 4-valent Lagrangian configurations, as proved algebraically in Section 4 via the symplectic direct sum decomposition. The back-and-forth line-direction pattern in each factor gives winding number 0 by angle cancellation.

tasks.note: All valid configs have det(E) >> 0, confirming the algebraic proof that 4 edge vectors span R^4.

tasks.task: P8-T3: Symplectic direct sum decomposition V1 + V2
tasks.note: omega(e1,e3) and omega(e2,e4) are always nonzero for valid configs, and the off-block entries vanish, confirming the symplectic direct sum.

tasks.task: P8-T4: Explicit winding number computation per factor
tasks.repair_status: CLOSED — the winding number is explicitly computed as sum of angle changes, each pair canceling exactly. This fills the gap flagged in Section 4.

problem_results.title: Polynomial detection of rank-1 scaling (quadrifocal tensors)

tasks.task: P9-T2: Universal converse for non-rank-1 lambda
tasks.note: Tests whether every non-rank-1 lambda has at least one nonzero 3x3 minor (for generic cameras). 0 violations = strong evidence for the universal converse.

tasks.task: P9-T3: Forward direction (rank-1 => all minors vanish)
tasks.note: All 3x3 minors should vanish exactly for rank-1 lambda. This is the proved direction (Section 3).

tasks.task: P9-T4: Extension from n=5 to n>=5 (Lemma 4.1)
tasks.note: For each n, every non-rank-1 lambda should have at least one nonzero minor detectable from a 5-camera subset.
Forward: rank-1 tensor => all matricizations rank 1. Converse: if (1,2)|(3,4) AND (1,3)|(2,4) are both rank 1, then f_{ab} and g_{gd} factor as outer products.
